result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristine N. Eddy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain employment.  Not to terminate employment without agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristine N. Eddy

records.addlTxt:
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Plead guilty to PAC 1st (15TR456) and Obstructing an officer with repeater enhancer stricken in 16CM20.  Amendment granted.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count she plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her pleas and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty PAC 1st, contrary to 346.63(1)(b) and Obstructing an Officer, contrary to 946.41(1).  15TR455 and 454 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes in 16CM20.  15TR457 dismissed by operation of law.  

Court ordered:  15TR456.  $887.50, fine and 6 month DL revocation.  Alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan.  Pay @ $50.00 per month, starting 6/15.    Failure to pay any part of the fine and court costs will result in 30 days jail.   On 16CM20: sentence withheld, 1 year probation. Concurrent with any probation now serving.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA, and recommended treatment.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Maintain employment.   Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  CC.
STC canceled and set for plea & sentencing along with other cases at request of Atty. Sebion this date.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located except for employment purposes only and subject to probation rules.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin and is properly insured.

Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located except for employment purposes only and subject to probation rules.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin and is properly insured.

Defendant appears in custody with counsel SPD Carly Sebion.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defense has received complaint and enters NGP, and requests case be set for PTC and STC.  Requests TR's to track and to enter NGP on those as well.  Court enters NGP on all charges; PTC set for 3-30-16 and STC for 4-18-16 at 3:00.  Civil citations are to track along with 16CM20.  Signature amended.
